item.title: Rachel add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "The most important decision you make is to be in a good mood." -- Voltaire

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Too much of a good thing can be wonderful!" -- Mae West

item.title: Rachel add a quote by jen lancaster
item.description: "I can't believe anyone would voluntarily run 26 miles. Sometimes I sit on the couch cross-legged because I don't feel like walking to the bathroom." -- jen lancaster

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "If you're going to try, go all the way. Otherwise, don't even start. This could mean losing girlfriends, wives, relatives and maybe even your mind. It could mean not eating for three or four days. It could mean freezing on a park bench. It could mean jail. It could mean derision. It could mean mockery--isolation. Isolation is the gift. All the others are a test of your endurance, of how much you really want to do it. And, you'll do it, despite rejection and the worst odds. And it will be better than anything else you can imagine. If you're going to try, go all the way. There is no other feeling like that. You will be alone with the gods, and the nights will flame with fire. You will ride life straight to perfect laughter. It's the only good fight there is." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Rachel add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Rachel add a quote by mahatma gandhi
item.description: "I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet." -- mahatma gandhi

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Woman is sacred; the woman one loves is holy." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "True love always makes a man better, no matter what woman inspires it." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "I'm the one that's got to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life the way I want to." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Amelia Earhart
item.description: "Everyone has ocean's to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries?" -- Amelia Earhart

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I hate people who are not serious about meals. It is so shallow of them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "My dear fellow, the truth isnâ€™t quite the sort of thing one tells to a nice, sweet, refined girl. What extraordinary ideas you have about the way to behave to a woman!" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Oh! I don't think I would like to catch a sensible man. I shouldn't know what to talk to him about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "This ghastly state of things is what you call Bunburying, I suppose? Algernon. Yes, and a perfectly wonderful Bunbury it is. The most wonderful Bunbury I have ever had in my life. Jack. Well, you've no right whatsoever to Bunbury here. Algernon. That is absurd. One has a right to Bunbury anywhere one chooses. Every serious Bunburyist knows that." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't play accurately--any one can play accurately--but I play with wonderful expression. As far as the piano is concerned, sentiment is my forte. I keep science for Life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Beware how you give your heart." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "To begin perfect happiness at the respective ages of 26 and 18 is to do pretty well" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Now I must give one smirk and then we may be rational again" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "To be fond of dancing was a certain step towards falling in love" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "You are too generous to trifle with me. If your feelings are still what they were last April, tell me so at once. My affections and wishes are unchanged; but one word from you will silence me on this subject for ever." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "An unhappy alternative is before you, Elizabeth. From this day you must be a stranger to one of your parents. Your mother will never see you again if you do not marry Mr. Collins, and I will never see you again if you do." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I have been a selfish being all my life, in practice, though not in principle. As a child I was taught what was right, but I was not taught to correct my temper. I was given good principles, but left to follow them in pride and conceit. Unfortunately an only son (for many years an only child), I was spoilt by my parents, who, though good themselves (my father, particularly, all that was benevolent and amiable), allowed, encouraged, almost taught me to be selfish and overbearing; to care for none beyond my own family circle; to think meanly of all the rest of the world; to wish at least to think meanly of their sense and worth compared with my own. Such I was, from eight to eight and twenty; and such I might still have been but for you, dearest, loveliest Elizabeth! What do I not owe you! You taught me a lesson, hard indeed at first, but most advantageous. By you, I was properly humbled. I came to you without a doubt of my reception. You showed me how insufficient were all my pretensions to please a woman worthy of being pleased." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John Green
item.description: "My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations." -- John Green
